attributes.action: revoke & make illegal the practice introduced by BT to penalty charge their customers for paying methods other than direct debit.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: British Telecom have introduced a penalty charge to all customers for not using the Direct Debit system. This goes against fairness for all and allow BT direct access to your bank account. Companies should not be allowed to dictate the method of payment that suits them & penalise you if you pay by a different method. It is noted also that this type of discrimination has been made illegal in Eire. This practice should not be allowed to continue here.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "revoke & make illegal the practice introduced by BT to penalty charge their customers for paying methods other than direct debit."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15980.asp
